page.title: 16ECOLOGY
page.content: For the best point of view on local ECOLOGY we visited the local artist Gordan Benningfield at Water End.He claims that much land is sprayed with PESTICIDES unnecessarily & some spray is too powerful. Sprays damage flowers,kill insects & birds & cause various allergies.Most countries have banned their use but unfortunately there is no such ban in Britain.Few people realise the extent of damage that has been caused since 1945. The river Gade contains rainbow trout which are put in by fishing syndicates and brown trout that are already there naturally.Voles & birds nest along the banks.Kingfishers,herons and bitterns are often seen in the area.The WOODLAND in the Gade Valley is inhabited by animals like badgers, stoats,deer & foxes.Some woodland is THREATENED by building developments
